intro: Aquilegia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered columbine, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that come in shades of red, purple, and blue. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring compound leaves with three to five leaflets. Its flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Aquilegia pauciflora is often found in woodland edges and rocky soils, thriving in partial shade to full sun.
